content.html:
Aria scratches her head. "Why is the answer 4 * 5?" she asked.

"Because we have five strawberry plants, each each plant needs four liters of water, we know that we need four liters of water, 5 times!" said Omar.

"That's why the multiplication expression for this situation is 4 * 5!"

hi.html: aariya sochti hai "uttar 4 * 5 kyon hai?" usane poochha. "kyonki hamaare paas paanch stroberee paudhe hain, pratyek paudhe ko chaar leetar paanee chahiye, ham jaanate hain ki hamen 4 leetar paanee chahiye, 5 baar!" umar ne kaha. "isliye gunan abhivyakti 4 * 5 hai!"

content.html:
Now that Aria has learned the parts of a multiplication equation, she and her father, Omar, will begin their fruit and vegetable garden!

You should know the following before going on:

  • How to write a multiplication expression from a picture

  • How to identify the parts of a multiplication expression

  • How to tell the “place values” in a number (e.g. ones, tens, hundreds, etc.)

You should also get some paper and a pen or pencil, and find a quiet place to work. Take your time. Understanding is more important than speed!

Once you’re ready, click Continue to get started!

"I get it!" said Aria. "The Commutative Property of Multiplication just says that the order of the factors doesn't matter when you multiply them."

"Yes!" said Omar. "Even if you switch the factors, you will get the same product."

hi.html: Mai samajh gayi! Aria ne kaha. gunan ka krumvinimay niyam kehta hai ki gunan mein sankhyon ki krum chaye jo bhi ho, uttar hamesha wohi hoga. Haan! Omar ne kaha, agar aap factor yani ghatak ka krum ulta bhi kar dete hain, toh wohi product yank gunphal aayega!

content.html:
Using the power of multiplication, Aria and Omar have successfully planted their strawberries and melons!

Congratulations! In this lesson, you learned about:

  • Solving multiplication expressions by drawing pictures and writing addition expressions
  • The Commutative Property of Multiplication
  • Multiplying by 0 and 1

In the next chapter, Aria and Omar will start planting vegetables in their garden! Join them next time to help them and to learn more about multiplication with Aria!

feedback.html: Correct!
No, that's not right. Remember that whenever a number is multiplied by 0, the answer is 0. Try again!

value: None of the above

content.html:
"Good job, Aria!" said Omar. "Now, one special case to remember when solving multiplication expressions is that anything times 0 equals 0!"

"So..." said Aria. "That means that 1 * 0 = 0, 4 * 0 = 0, and 12,345 * 0 = 0!"

"Right," said Omar. "When we say we’re multiplying something by 0, we’re really just adding nothing together, so the answer is always 0. "

What is 1 * 0?

hi.html:
"bahut accha, aariya!" omar ne kaha. "ab, gunan abhivyaktiyon ke uttar dene samay yaad rakho ki agar kisi bhee sankhya shoony se gina hua hai toh jawaab 0 hoga!"

"to" "aariya ne socha. "isaka matalab hai ki 1 * 0 = 0, 4 * 0 = 0, aur 12345 * 0 = 0!" "sahee hai," umar ne kaha. "jab ham kahate hain ki ham 0 se kuchh guna kar rahe hain, to ham vaastav mein kuchh bhee nahin jod rahe hain, isalie uttar hamesha 0. hai." 1 * 0 kya hai?

feedback.html: Correct!
Correct!

No, that's not right. Remember that the first factor in a multiplication expression is the number you are multiplying. The second factor is the number of times it is being multiplied. 

Try again!

content.html:
“What if I don’t want to draw a picture every time I want to solve a multiplication problem?” Aria asked.

“You can also solve multiplication expressions by turning them back to addition and then solving the addition expression instead,” Omar replied. 

“Ok," said Aria. "I get it! So, if I don't know what 6 * 3 is and don't want to draw a picture, I can turn it into an addition problem and solve it!""Yes!" said Omar. "Now, what is 6 * 3 as an addition expression?"

content.html:
“One way to find the value of multiplication expressions is by turning them into drawings.” Omar said.

“For example, if we have 5 * 3, we know that would be the same as having five groups of three items each. Select the picture which shows 5 * 3 in groups of seeds.”

content.html:
Here's a little help from Omar. Read it carefully!

"Okay Aria," said Omar. "Because there are five strawberry bushes, and each bush needs four liters of water, we know the multiplication expression is 5 * 4. Now, we can solve this in two ways!"

Omar continued. "First, we can draw a picture with five strawberry plants and four liters of water for each plant. Then, we can count all the liters of water."

"Or, we count convert 5 * 4 to an addition expression, like 5 + 5 + 5 + 5. Then, we would solve 5 + 5 + 5 + 5."

"Both ways give us the same answer. Now, what is the answer to 5 * 4?"

hi.html:
yahaan umar se thodee madad milegi. ise dhyaan se padhen!

"theek hai aariya," umar ne kaha. "kyonki paanch stroberee paudon hain, aur pratyek pauda ko chaar leetar paanee chahiye, ham jaanate hain ki gunan abhivyakti 5 * 4 hai. ab, ham ise do tareekon se jawab nikal sakate hain!" umar ne bataya. "pahale, ham pratyek paudhe ke lie paanch stroberee paudhon aur chaar leetar paanee ke saath ek tasveer kheench sakate hain. phir, ham sabhee leetar paanee kee ginatee kar sakate hain." "ya, ham 5 * 4 ko ek atirikt abhivyakti mein badalate hain, jaise 5 + 5 + 5 + 5. phir, ham 5 + 5 + 5 + 5 ko hal karenge." "donon tareeke hamen ek hee javaab dete hain. ab, 5 * 4 ka javaab kya hai?"

"Wonderful job!" said Omar. "Now, one last thing to know! When you multiply any number by 1, you’re just adding the same number once, so any number times 1 is equal to itself."

"Find the answer to 3 * 1."

content.html:
As Omar continued to help Aria learn multiplication, she looked up at the sun. "Dad!" she said. "It's really hot today, and we forgot to water the strawberry plants!"

"Ah, thanks for reminding me," smiled Omar. "We have five strawberry plants. If each plant needs 4 liters of water, write a multiplication expression for how much water we need for all the strawberry plants."

"aah, mujhe yaad dilaane ke lie dhanyavaad," umar muskuraaya. "hamaare paas paanch stroberee paudhe hain. agar har ek paudhe ko chaar leetar paanee chahiye, to ham sabhee stroberee paudhon ke lie kitane paanee chahiye hogi? isake lie pehle ek gunan abhivyakti likho."

content.html:
“Now that you know what 5 * 3 looks like in a drawing, all you have to do to get the answer is to count up how many items there are in total," Omar said.

“So, even though I don’t know what 5 * 3 is, can I draw out a picture to find the answer?” Aria asked.

“That’s right!” said Omar. "So, using the picture we chose for 5 * 3, what is 5 * 3?"

Aria and her father are thinking about how they could use multiplication to plan out their garden.

"Yesterday, I learned that multiplication is repeated addition." said Aria. "I also learned that in a multiplication expression, one factor is the number of groups, the other factor is the number of items in each group, and the product is the total number of items!"

"Yes!" said Omar. "I'm excited to start gardening. Today, we will plant your favorite fruit: melon, and my favorite fruit: strawberries!"

"Today, we planted five melon seeds," said Omar. "Now, it's time to water them! If each watermelon plant needs 7 liters of water every day, and we have five melon seeds, find out how many total liters of water we need for all five melon plants. Remember, you can draw a picture to figure out the answer!"

content.html: "What do you call the number that you get from two or more numbers being multiplied together?" asked Omar.

Omar smiled. "Good job! Now, let's enjoy some chocolate!" Omar unwrapped a chocolate bar, which Aria looked at excitedly.

"Look at this chocolate bar. Using multiplication, we want to know how many chocolate squares there are in this bar!"

"There are two rows of chocolate squares. Each row has five squares. A multiplication expression we can use to find the total number of chocolate squares is 2 * 5."

"However, we can also see that there are five columns of chocolate squares. In this case, each column has two chocolate squares. Another multiplication expression we can use to find the total number of chocolate squares here is 5 * 2."

"5 * 2 = 2 * 5 because they both equal 10. The order of the factors has no effect on the product."

This is called the Commutative Property of Multiplication, meaning you can multiply two or more numbers in any order and get the same answer.

hi.html:
Omar khush hua. "Bahut acha! 3 * 5 ke lie sahee tasveer mein 3 vaaston ke 5 samoohon hai. aur 3 * 5 ka jawaab 15 hai! lekin kuchh aur cheez hai jo aapako jaanana chahiye, Aria!"

"Agar aap 5 beejon ke saath 3 samooh banaate hain, to usme bhi aapako ek hee uttar milega. Pehli tasveer 3 * 5 dikhaatee hai. doosaree tasveer 5 * 3. dikhaatee hai. donon chitron mein, 15 beej hain!"

yah gunan ka krumvinimay niyam mein jaana jaata hai. aap kisee bhee kram mein do ya adhik sankhyaon ko guna kar sakate hain aur ek hee uttar milega. isalie, yadi aap 3 * 5 ya 5 * 3 dekhate hain, to yaad rakhen ki dono ke ek hee uttar hai.

exploration.title: What Multiplication Means
exploration.objective: Learn all about multiplication and how to use it in the real world!
